item.title: Iran Nuclear Talks Still Face ‘Difficult Issues,’ Kerry Says
item.description: Iran’s insistence on the lifting of a ban on shipments of conventional weapons in and out of the country has become an obstacle to an accord.
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL R. GORDON

item.title: Blast at Italian Consulate’s Compound in Cairo Kills at Least 1
item.description: The attack was the first major bombing of a diplomatic mission in Egypt since the start of an insurgency nearly two years ago.
item.dc:creator: KAREEM FAHIM
item.media:description: Police officers standing at the base of the Italian Consulate in Cairo on Saturday after an explosion caused sections of its walls to collapse.

item.title: U.S. Strike Is Said to Kill Senior ISIS Militant in Afghanistan
item.description: The death of the senior militant, Hafiz Saeed Khan, in an airstrike Friday was reported by Afghan officials but could not be confirmed independently.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: MUJIB MASHAL

item.title: Mass Evacuation in China as Typhoon Chan-Hom Hits Coast
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of people were moved to safer areas before the storm struck Zhejiang Province on Saturday afternoon with winds of about 100 miles per hour.
item.dc:creator: CHRIS BUCKLEY

item.title: Sex Abuse Trial of Ex-Vatican Envoy Is Delayed
item.description: The Vatican proceedings were adjourned after the defendant, Jozef Wesolowski, fell ill. He is accused of abusing boys in the Dominican Republic.
item.dc:creator: GAIA PIANIGIANI

item.title: Greece Financial Crisis Hits Poorest and Hungriest the Hardest
item.description: With banks still closed as debt talks continue, many fear the potential impact on already-stretched food supplies and social services in Athens and beyond.
item.dc:creator: ANEMONA HARTOCOLLIS

item.title: Greece’s Parliament Approves Prime Minister’s Bailout Plan
item.description: The measure, which passed by an overwhelming margin one day before Sunday’s deadline, is remarkably similar to the one Greek voters rejected less than a week ago.
item.dc:creator: LIZ ALDERMAN and ANDREW HIGGINS
item.media:description: Euclid Tsakalotos, the Greek finance minister, on Friday at a meeting of the Syriza party, which was said to be tense because of serious objections among legislators over the additional austerity measures that are laid out in the proposals.

item.title: News Analysis: A Final Hurdle in Iran Talks Deals With Conventional, Not Nuclear, Arms
item.description: The sanctions, first passed in 2006, ban the shipment of conventional arms into and out of Iran and appeared to have been resolved months ago.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
item.dc:creator: MICHAEL R. GORDON and DAVID E. SANGER

item.title: Malaysia’s Critics Fear U.S. May Ease Stance on Trafficking
item.description: Senator Robert Menendez and rights advocates voiced alarm over reporting that the State Department might upgrade Malaysia’s record on human trafficking.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: ANDREW SIDDONS

item.title: South Sudan Enemies Find Uneasy Refuge Together at a U.N. Base
item.description: People from three ethnic groups engaged in a civil war have made homes on a United Nations peacekeeping base.
item.dc:creator: MARC SANTORA
item.media:description: People from at least three warring ethnic groups live side by side in a camp near Malakal, South Sudan.

item.title: World Briefing: France: Extremist Leader Gets 9 Years for Terrorism
item.description: The chief of a dismantled radical network in France was sentenced Friday to nine years in prison for recruiting for jihad and plotting attacks against Jewish sites.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: Shabab Militants Strike 2 Hotels in Somalia
item.description: The attacks in Mogadishu, the capital, appeared to have been coordinated, witnesses and officials said. At least six civilians were reported wounded.
item.dc:creator: MOHAMMED IBRAHIM

item.title: Open Source: Belgian Liberal Basks in Viral Fame for Scolding Greek Prime Minister
item.description: While the Greek debt crisis remains unresolved, at least one European politician clearly seems to be enjoying himself.
item.dc:creator: ROBERT MACKEY

item.title: ​Omar Sharif, 83, a Star in ‘Lawrence of Arabia’ and ‘Doctor Zhivago,’ Dies
item.description: Mr. Sharif was a commanding presence onscreen, multilingual and comfortable in almost any role or cultural setting.
item.dc:creator: ROBERT BERKVIST

item.title: Signs of a Growing Hush in China’s Economy
item.description: Small signs of malaise are emerging after the stock market slump, from the deferral of major purchases to desperate attempts to restart cash flow.
item.dc:creator: KEITH BRADSHER

item.title: Turkey Arrests 21 Suspected of Ties to ISIS
item.description: In early morning raids Friday in Istanbul and Sanliurfa Province, which borders Syria, the police also seized automatic rifles, ammunition and military uniforms.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: CEYLAN YEGINSU

item.title: India Inquiry Into Scandal Over Testing Set to Expand
item.description: The Supreme Court of India ordered the federal authorities to take over a probe into a testing scandal in the state of Madhya Pradesh that has involved numerous arrests and possibly deaths.
item.dc:creator: NIDA NAJAR and SUHASINI RAJ

item.title: América : El papa pide perdón en Bolivia por los ‘graves pecados’ de la Iglesia durante la era colonial
item.description: Francisco es el primer papa latinoamericano, y su disculpa coincide con su intento de presentar a la Iglesia como una institución defensora de los pobres en el continente.
item.media:description: El Papa Francisco dió su discurso en Santa Cruz durante el II Congreso Mundial de Movientos Populares en Bolivia.

item.title: In Athens, Greeks Wonder Whether Tsipras Folded or Restored Dignity
item.description: Greeks were struggling to process the news, gird themselves for further budget cutbacks and assess what they had gotten for their efforts to stand against the European orthodoxy.
item.dc:creator: SUZANNE DALEY and ANEMONA HARTOCOLLIS
item.media:description: Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras of Greece, seated, was applauded by members of his governing Syriza Party at the Parliament building in Athens on Friday.

item.title: Iran Opens Campaign to Lay Blame on U.S. if Nuclear Talks Fail
item.description: Iranian officials have begun a campaign to assure citizens that the government has done everything possible to reach an agreement that lifts economic sanctions.
item.dc:creator: THOMAS ERDBRINK
item.media:description: Secretary of State John Kerry with Jonathan Finer, left, the State Department’s chief of staff, and other members of the American delegation in Vienna for negotiations on Friday.
